text:
Mr. [**Known lastname 8498**] is a 73 yoM on HD-anuric, h/o AFib not currently on
   coumadin (though is on at home), who is being transferred from the
   neurology service for respiratory distress and hypoxia.  He was
   admitted on [**2191-8-12**] after a fall resulting in acute on chronic SDH on
   the left; his course is complicated by seizure and he has been started
   on fosphenytoin & phenytoin.
   .
   This evening he was noted to be in acute respiratory distress with
   desats to the low to mid 90's on 3LNC (reportedly desatting to the mid
   70's on room air; has had a variable O2 requirement since being
   admitted).  His blood pressure dropped to the 70's systolic and was
   responsive to the 80's and then 100's after a 250 cc NS bolus.  he was
   febrile to 101.9,concern was aspiration event,pt has been on on
   vanco/genta for the given recent fevers,with neg cultures
    he was briefly in MICU green on [**8-17**] - [**8-18**] for fevers and hypotension
   to the 70's.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Remains vented on ACx18/500/40%/5.  LS diminished at bases.  Sats
   94-97% Pt sedated on fentanyl and versed drips.  He is able to follow
   commands inconsistently.
   Action:
   Suctioned for thick copious secretions q 2-4 hours.
   Response:
   No change. Pt maintaining good saturation
   Plan:
   Wean vent as tolerated.  CXR in am.  ? a line placement if long term
   ventilation needed.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   TMAX  102.4 axillary.
   Action:
   Rectal Tylenol given.  Cooling blanket placed on pt.  Pt started on
   cefepime.
   Response:
   Temperature decreased to 97.9.  Awaiting culture data.
   Plan:
   Administer Tylenol as needed.  Continue to monitor
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   HR 90
s SR.  BP 98-137/29-39.  Pt remains on levophed drip to maintain
   systolic BPs >100.  Pt continues to have large residual from NGT so pt
   remains NPO.  Elevated FS despite being NPO. Pt is HD dependent.  He
   currently does not have access.
   Action:
   Attempted to wean levophed.  Able to decrease dose to .06mcgs/kg/min
   from .12mcgs/kg/min.
   Response:
   Systolic goal >100.
   Plan:
   Wean levophed to off if tolerated.  Dialysis tomorrow. Pt will need
   access placed.
